meanings.definition: A slender threadlike structure or bundle, such as a nerve or muscle fiber.
meanings.sent1: The funiculus carried important messages from the brain to the body.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully dissected the funiculus to repair the damaged nerve.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the funiculus as a tightrope to cross the road.
meanings.sent4: The funiculus of trust connected their hearts even when miles apart.
meanings.sent5: The glowing funiculus of light illuminated the dark cave.

meanings.definition: A cord-like structure in plants, such as a stem or root.
meanings.sent1: The funiculus of the plant anchored it firmly in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The gardener gently pruned the funiculus to promote healthy growth.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat mistook the funiculus for a toy and batted at it.
meanings.sent4: The funiculus of the vine reached out like a helping hand to other plants.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green funiculus coiled around the tree trunk for support.
